description: In this introductory course in financial management, students will learn the fundamentals of budgeting and accounting for public and not-for-profit organizations. Through readings, lectures, real-world case studies, and assignments, students will gain an understanding of how to use financial information in organizational planning, implementation, control, reporting, and analysis. In addition, students will develop their spreadsheet skills by using Microsoft Excel to perform financial analysis and create financial documents. Key topics include operating budgets, cash budgets, break-even analysis, cost allocation, the time value of money, capital budgeting, long-term financing, and preparation and analysis of financial statements.
title: Financial Management for Public Organisations
